description: Manage revoked certificates in a virtual network gateway. Prevent machines using this certificate from accessing Azure through this gateway.

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert create
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert create --gateway-name
                                            --name
                                            --resource-group
                                            --thumbprint
                                            [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRootCertificate --gateway-name MyVnetGateway --thumbprint abc123

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert delete
commands.syntax:
az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert delete --gateway-name
                                            --name
                                            --resource-group
                                            [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRootCertificate --gateway-name MyVnetGateway
az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert delete --gateway-name MyVnetGateway --name MyRootCertificate --resource-group MyResourceGroup --subscription MySubscription

commands.name: az network vnet-gateway revoked-cert wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
